title: Memories of underdevelopment = Memorias del subdesarrollo
creator_contributor_role: Instituto Cubano del Arte e Industrias Cinematográficos (ICAIC), production company
subject_group: Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Alienation (Social psychology)
Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Foreign language films
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Self-actualization (Psychology)
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Cuba - Politics and government
Family, Gender Identity, Relationships & Sexuality/Alienation (Social psychology)
description: 'Memories of Underdevelopment' is the diary of a middle-class intellectual caught in the midst of the rapidly changing social reality of revolutionary Cuba. Sergio is a landlord and self-styled writer who decides to remain behind when his wife, family and friends, whom he ridicules, leave for Miami. But Sergio is unable to commit himself to the revolution either, and so remains only a sceptical observer. His perceptions of Cuban society, both before and after the revolution, are skillfully interwoven with documentary footage of historical events (the Bay of Pigs invasion, the Cuban Missile Crisis of 1962, and so on) to yield a complex and fascinating portrait of an individual alienated from the social process around him. Based on the novel by Esmundo Desnoes. In Spanish with English subtitles. Cast includes Sergio Corrieri, Daisy Granados, Eslinda Nunez, Omar Valdes and Rene de la Cruz.
